AMK Companion App 1.1 documentation
AMK Companion App 1.1 documentation
  • Usage
Back to top

amk module#

This module defines the AMK object used to store all the keyboard data, and module contains the <keyname>:<keycode> mapping used in the keyboard.

class amk.AMK(**kwargs)#

Bases: object

classmethod init_from_dict(dict, callback)#

Constructs an AMK object from a filled dictionary.

is_full()#

Returns ‘’True’’ if AMK data is full, i.e. all attributes have non-default values

save_to_arduino()#

Sends the callback function all data required to update the AMK device

to_dict()#

Returns a dictionary representing the object.

to_string()#

Returns a string representing the object.

classmethod get_code_of(name) → str#

Returns the code of the key whose name was given.

classmethod get_key_names() → list#

Returns the names of all keys supported by AMK.

classmethod get_name_of(code)#

Returns the name of the key whose code was given.
